meanings.definition: Publicly declare to be wrong or evil.
meanings.sent1: The mayor decided to denounce the corrupt practices in the city.
meanings.sent2: She bravely denounce the unfair treatment of workers in the factory.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would denounce bad jokes at the comedy club.
meanings.sent4: Her powerful speech denouncing discrimination resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used the story to denounce bullying behavior in the classroom.

meanings.sent1: The witness was willing to denounce the criminal to the police.
meanings.sent2: He decided to denounce his friend's illegal activities to the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The detective asked the informant to denounce the suspect discreetly.
meanings.sent4: She had to denounce her partner's betrayal to protect herself.
meanings.sent5: The whistleblower chose to denounce the company's unethical practices.

meanings.sent1: The journalist will denounce the government's new policy in her article.
meanings.sent2: He used his platform to denounce the celebrity's offensive remarks.
meanings.sent3: The fans were quick to denounce the team's poor performance on social media.
meanings.sent4: Her speech at the rally aimed to denounce the lack of action on climate change.
meanings.sent5: The activist continued to denounce the company's harmful environmental practices.
